books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and a cautionary tale of a totalitarian regime based on propaganda, surveillance, and censorship.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A deeply moving novel centered around themes of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A classic novel that explores themes of teenage angst and alienation through the eyes of protagonist Holden Caulfield.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A romantic novel of manners that depicts the emotional development of protagonist Elizabeth Bennet, who learns about the repercussions of hasty judgments.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A dystopian novel presenting a future society driven by technological advancements, leading to lost individuality.

books.title: Moby Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: An epic sea adventure of Captain Ahab's obsession with capturing the giant white whale, Moby Dick.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A sweeping novel that combines history, philosophy, and fiction to depict Russian society during the Napoleonic Era.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.description: A philosophical story that explores the theme of finding one's destiny or purpose in life.

books.title: Animal Farm
books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A satirical allegorical novella reflecting events leading up to the Russian Revolution and then on into the Stalinist era of the Soviet Union.
